FuncDef: To limit the number of routes redistributed into Open Shortest Path First (OSPF), use the redistribute maximum-prefix command. To return to the default setting, use the no form of this command.
CLIs: no redistribute maximum-prefix <max> [ <threshold> ] [ warning-only | withdraw [ <num-retries timeout> ]

ParaDef.Info: Maximum number of prefixes that OSPF will distribute. The range is from 0 to 65535.
(Optional) Percentage of maximum prefixes that triggers a warning message. The range is from 1 to 100. The default is 75 percent.
(Optional) Logs a warning message when the maximum number of prefixes is exceeded.
(Optional) Number of times OSPF tries to retrieve the redistributed routes. The range is from 1 to 12. The default is 1.
(Optional) Time between retry attempts. The range is from 60 to 600 seconds. The default is 300.

ExtraInfo:
Use the clear ip ospf redistribute command if all routes are withdrawn.This command requires the LAN Base Services license.
Command Default:No limit
msg: Error CLI:no redistribute maximum-prefix <max> [ <threshold> ] [ warning-only | withdraw [ <num-retries timeout> ]
